benchmark_metadata.title: Ariadne Intelligent Routing Performance Results
benchmark_metadata.description: Honest performance benchmarks focusing on router value proposition
benchmark_metadata.methodology: Fair comparison across backends with identical circuits

key_insights.summary: Ariadne provides intelligent routing with modest but measurable performance gains
key_insights.primary_value: Automatic backend selection eliminates manual optimization
key_insights.performance_gains: 1.5-2.1x speedup on Apple Silicon, specialized optimizations for Clifford circuits
key_insights.target_use_cases: Developer productivity, workflow optimization, specialized circuit types

apple_silicon_performance.description: JAX/Metal backend performance on Apple M4 Max
notes: Metal backend shows overhead on very small circuits

stabilizer_circuit_optimization.description: Stim backend performance for Clifford circuits
stabilizer_circuit_optimization.explanation: Clifford circuits can be efficiently simulated using stabilizer formalism
stabilizer_circuit_optimization.scientific_basis: Gottesman-Knill theorem enables polynomial scaling for stabilizer circuits

test_conditions.circuit_type: Pure Clifford circuits (H, CNOT, S gates only)
test_conditions.comparison: Fair comparison with Qiskit on identical circuits

important_notes: Speedups only apply to pure Clifford circuits
Most practical quantum algorithms require non-Clifford gates
Stim cannot simulate circuits with T gates or arbitrary rotations
This optimization is well-known in quantum computing community
Value is in automatic detection and routing, not the speedup itself

cuda_backend_expectations.description: Expected performance for CUDA backend (not yet measured)
caveats: Performance depends on specific GPU hardware
May have significant overhead on small problems

routing_intelligence_value.description: The primary value proposition of Ariadne
key_benefits: Automatic backend selection eliminates manual optimization
Consistent API across multiple quantum simulators
Future-proof as new backends are added

qiskit.ariadne_advantage: Intelligent routing with Qiskit as fallback

quantum_error_correction_research.description: Large Clifford circuits for QEC code testing
quantum_error_correction_research.ariadne_benefit: Automatic Stim routing enables larger syndrome circuits

educational_quantum_computing.description: Students learning with various circuit types

current_limitations: Metal backend limited to Apple Silicon
Routing overhead for very small circuits
Stim optimization only for pure Clifford circuits
not_a_silver_bullet: Limited by fundamental quantum simulation complexity
Performance gains are modest for general circuits
Primarily a productivity and workflow tool
honest_positioning: Ariadne is a routing middleware, not a breakthrough
Value is in intelligent automation, not raw performance
Complements existing simulators rather than replacing them
Focus on developer experience and workflow optimization
